page.title: 02SESSAY ECOLOGY
page.content: The main acreage of old established woodland, conifers and birch, is Clark Wood, but it was reduced from 73 acres to 21 acres in 1984. {FLORA:}primroses, bluebells, dog violets, a few cowslips and a wide variety in roadsides and hedges. The fields are mainly cleared by selective weedkillers. {FAUNA:}plenty of deer, foxes, rabbits, hares, grey squirrels and hedgehogs. {CULTIVATED FIELDS:}grassland, cereals, potatoes, sugarbeet, also some acreage of soft fruit. {CLIMATE:}humid temperate area but can be subject to fog. Generally mild winters. High winds mainly from west but some protection by trees and hedges and where not protected the soil tends to blow in dry weather in spring.
